alert.note: Alert for Frenchman Basin (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued October 18 at 1:26PM CDT until October 19 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...CRITICAL FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS POSSIBLE WEDNESDAY... .Warm dry air accompanied by strong northwest winds will spread through southwest Nebraska Wednesday afternoon...potentially producing a critical fire weather situation. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING FOR LOW HUMIDITY AND STRONG WINDS FOR THE FRENCHMAN BASIN IN SOUTHWEST NEBRASKA... The National Weather Service in North Platte has issued a Fire Weather Watch for low humidity and strong winds, which is in effect from Wednesday afternoon through Wednesday evening. * AFFECTED AREA...Fire Weather Zone 210 Frenchman Basin. * TIMING...From noon to 6 pm MDT. * WINDS...Northwest 10 to 20 mph with gusts up to 30 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 17 percent. * TEMPERATURES...In the low to mid 70s.
info.instruction: A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.
